Class Rotor

  • java.lang.Object
    • Rotor
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Configuration, PipelineElement

    public class Rotor
extends java.lang.Object
implements PipelineElement, Configuration

    A class that implements two interfaces and implements the basic component of an Enigma machine : a rotor. It deals with rotation of rotors, encoding and so on. All of these are implemented as inner functionalities.

    Author:
    Theodor Stoican

    • Method Detail

      • setAlphabet

        public void setAlphabet(java.lang.String alphabet)

        A method that sets the alphabet for the rotor, necessary when realizing a specific mapping (encoding).

        Parameters:
        alphabet - a string that represents the alphabet

      • setConfiguration

        public void setConfiguration(char[] elem)

        A method that sets up the configuration of a rotor. It will be useful when mapping a specific character. It is an overriden method.

        Specified by:
        setConfiguration in interface Configuration
        Parameters:
        elem - an array of char representing pairs (A,B) which will be mapped one on another

      • setStellung

        public void setStellung(int numRotor,
               char ringStellung,
               char grundStellung,
               char notch)

        A method which is used for setting the notches, Grundstellung, Ringstellung and the number of the rotors which will be later used on computing the codification of a specific input.

        Parameters:
        numRotor - the number of the rotor
        ringStellung - the character offset of the ring
        grundStellung - the character offset of the rotor
        notch - a character which will chain rotations

      • setStellung

        public void setStellung(int numRotor,
               char ringStellung,
               char grundStellung,
               char[] notch)

        A method that overloads the other method with the same name, but which will be used for the 6th, 7th and 8th rotors, since these possess more than a single notch.

        Parameters:
        numRotor -
        ringStellung -
        grundStellung -
        notch -

      • setNeighbour1

        public void setNeighbour1(Rotor neighbour1)

        A method that will set a specific neighbour.

        Parameters:
        neighbour1 - a neighbour of type Rotor

      • transmitInput

        public void transmitInput(char input,
                 java.lang.String type)

        A method that encodes a specific character, calls the rotation function for the rotors and so on. It is based on direct or inverse mapping, depending therefore on an input.

        Specified by:
        transmitInput in interface PipelineElement
        Parameters:
        input - the character to be encoded
        type - the type of the codification

      • receiveOutput

        public char receiveOutput()

        A method that will be called for getting back the encoded input.

        Specified by:
        receiveOutput in interface PipelineElement
        Parameters:
        none -
        Returns:
        char returns the encoded character
